title: Police hunt man who raped woman in her twenties near Butlins
text:
Police are hunting a man who raped a woman as she walked back to her room at Butlins.

The woman in her 20s was attacked as she made her way back to her hotel at the resort in Bognor Regis during the early hours of the morning.

Sussex police said the woman was approached by an unknown man at around 12.47am before he attacked her.

The woman in her 20s was attacked as she made her way back to her hotel at the resort in Bognor Regis during the early hours of the morning. Pictured are police at the scene

Officers are conducting enquiries at the scene and attempts are ongoing to identify the suspect while the victim receives support from specially trained officers.

Detective Inspector Jon Robeson said: 'This was an isolated incident and thankfully, incidents of this nature are relatively rare.

'We will have an increased police presence in the area today and we would urge anyone with any information to contact us quoting Operation Tiverton.'

A spokesman for Sussex police said: 'Police are investigating a report of a rape, which is alleged to have occurred in Upper Bognor Road, Bognor Regis, around 12.47am on Monday 14 October.

'A woman in her 20s reported walking back to her hotel at a nearby holiday resort when she was approached by an unknown man, who carried out the attack.'

Sussex police said the woman was approached by an unknown man at around 12.47am before he attacked her
description: The woman in her 20s was attacked as she made her way back to her hotel at the resort in Bognor Regis during the early hours of the morning.
